x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Donations in the form of cash, goods, or services move through multiple hands — donors, NGOs, vendors, logistics partners, and field volunteers — yet visibility across the entire chain is weak. As a result, funds are lost or diverted, distributions are duplicated, receipts can’t be verified, and donor confidence drops.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: AidFlow – Transparent Donation & Relief Tracking Platform
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • App Engine Studio: to build custom donation, procurement, and beneficiary records

  • Flow Designer: for automated workflows (donation approvals, status updates, audits)

  • IntegrationHub: to connect with banking/payment APIs, logistics systems, and ERP tools

  • Now Mobile / UI Builder: for clean, mobile-friendly donor and field agent dashboards

  • Performance Analytics: for impact metrics, SDG alignment, and fraud detection insights

  • Document Management & Attachment API: to store receipts, invoices, and verification photos

  • Data Encryption & Access Control Lists (ACLs): to protect sensitive donor and beneficiary data

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • APIs for financial transactions (bank, mobile money, or payment gateways)

  • Logistics or inventory APIs for shipment tracking (optional)

  • Optional blockchain or immutable ledger for high-trust audits

  • Offline data sync service for areas with poor internet connectivity

  • Map or geolocation services (Google Maps or OpenStreetMap) for site verification

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Connectivity: Field teams often operate with weak or no internet, requiring robust offline design.

  • Data Quality: Incomplete or inaccurate reports require strong validation and user training.

  • Adoption: NGOs are used to manual tools; onboarding and incentives will be essential.

  • Multi-party Coordination: Aligning donors, vendors, and NGOs on shared data standards takes time.

  • Privacy: Handling beneficiary data requires compliance with data protection laws and consent management.

  • Fraud Prevention: Fake photo or signature submissions must be mitigated via timestamps, GPS, and audit checks.

  • Sustainability: Post-pilot, long-term maintenance needs a sustainable funding or subscription model.
